library.description: Crossroads.js is a routing library inspired by URL Route/Dispatch utilities present on frameworks like Rails, Pyramid, Django, CakePHP, CodeIgniter, etc... It parses a string input and decides which action should be executed by matching the string against multiple patterns.
library.name: Crossroads.js

library.description: Toxiclibsjs is an open-source library for computational design tasks with JavaScript. It is a port of Karsten Schmidt's Toxiclibs for Java and Processing. Toxiclibs.js works great with Canvas, with SVG or any ordinary DOM element. Examples pair with such fine libraries as: Processing.js, Three.js, or Raphael.js for SVG.
library.name: Toxiclibsjs

library.description: This package implements a general-purpose JavaScript parser/compressor/beautifier toolkit. It is developed on NodeJS, but it should work on any JavaScript platform supporting the CommonJS module system (and if your platform of choice doesn’t support CommonJS, you can easily implement it, or discard the exports.* lines from UglifyJS sources).
library.name: UglifyJS

library.description: string.js, or simply S is a lightweight (< 4k minified and gzipped) JavaScript library for the browser or for Node.js that provides extra String methods. Originally, it modified the String prototype. But I quickly learned that in JavaScript, this is considered poor practice.
library.name: String.js

library.description: Javascript lacks complete string manipulation operations. This an attempt to fill that gap. List of build-in methods can be found for example from Dive Into JavaScript.
library.name: Underscore String

library.description:
IcedCoffeeScript is a superset of CoffeeScript. The iced interpreter is a drop-in replacement for the standard coffee interpreter; it will interpret almost all existing CoffeeScript programs.

IcedCoffeeScript (ICS) adds two new keywords: await and defer. These additions simply and powerfully streamline asynchronous control flow, both on the server and on the browser. Say goodbye to callback pyramids; say adios to massive code rewrites when synchronization requirements change slightly. Say hello to clean, readable, maintainable control flow for network and asynchronous operations!
library.name: IcedCoffeeScript

library.description: Kaffeine is a set of extensions to the Javascript syntax that attempt to make it nicer to use. It compiles directly into javascript that is very similar, readable and line for line equivalent to the input (you can beautify if you like).
library.name: Kaffeine

library.description: Minimal & Fast DOM elements creation.
library.name: Domator

library.description: Open-source library for keeping package.json dependencies up-to-date via repository merges and Pull Requests. Supports GitHub and GitLab.
library.name: Renovate

library.description: A lib for easily translating and manipulating colors and sets of colors centered around xterm-256 pallette
library.name: Repl-Rainbow

library.description: Parse and stringify URL query strings.
library.name: query-string

library.description: A modern browser development toolkit. JavaScript, CSS, and template compilers, linting, optimization, serving, RequireJS support, and Live Reload built right in. Pluggable for authoring your own functionality.
library.name: Mimosa

library.description: Brunch is an assembler for HTML5 applications. It‘s agnostic to frameworks, libraries, programming, stylesheet & templating languages and backend technology.
library.name: Brunch

library.description: Grunt is a task-based command line build tool for JavaScript projects
library.name: Grunt

library.description:
Bower is a package manager for the web. It offers a generic, unopinionated solution to the problem of front-end package management, while exposing the package dependency model via an API that can be consumed by a more opinionated build stack. There are no system wide dependencies, no dependencies are shared between different apps, and the dependency tree is flat.

Bower runs over Git, and is package-agnostic. A packaged component can be made up of any type of asset, and use any type of transport (e.g., AMD, CommonJS, etc.).
library.name: Bower

library.description: Spectacular is a BDD framework for CoffeeScript and JavaScript whose attempt to bring the power of RSpec to JavaScript. Spectacular tries to favor the best practices used for writing better RSpec tests in its design.
library.name: Spectacular

library.description:
Negative array index support using ES6 Proxy.

var a=[1,2,3]; a[-1] //=> 3
library.name: negative-array

library.description: Component package manager for building a better web.
library.name: Component

library.description: Stringify an object/array like JSON.stringify just without all the double-quotes. Useful for when you want to get the string representation of an object in a formatted way.
library.name: stringify-object

library.description: A bit of sugar for defining objects and their prototypes.
library.name: defineObject

library.description: Generate random numbers that are consecutively unique.
library.name: unique-random

library.description: Detect the indentation of some code. Useful if you need to persist indentation or have new content match existing indentation.
library.name: detect-indent

library.description:
For front-end developers who crave maintainable assets,
Jam is a package manager for JavaScript.
 Unlike other repositories, we put the browser first.
library.name: Jam

library.description: A highly modular, loosely coupled, non-frameworky framework for building advanced JavaScript apps.
library.name: Ampersand.js

library.description: Volo is a tool which lets you quickly create projects, add libraries, and automate common tasks using node and JavaScript.
library.name: Volo

library.description: An immutable Javascript color object that works in the browser and NodeJS with support for RGB, HSV, HSL and CMYK. Complete with alpha channel support in all color spaces and implicit color space conversion when getting/modifying a color channel from a different color space.
library.name: one.color

library.description: Parse and stringify the HTML  srcset attribute.
library.name: srcset

library.description:
Developed at Twitter to support our internal styleguide, RECESS is a simple, attractive code quality tool for CSS built on top of LESS.

Incorporate it into your development process as a linter, or integrate it directly into your build system as a compiler, RECESS will keep your source looking clean and super manageable.
library.name: Recess

library.description:
The RaptorJS Optimizer is a Node.js-style module bundler that also provides first-level support for optimally delivering JavaScript, CSS, images and other assets to the browser.

This tool offers many different optimizations such as a bundling, code splitting, lazy loading, compression and fingerprinted resource URLs. Plugins are provided to support pre-processors and compilers such as Less, Stylus and Marko. This developer-friendly tool does not require that you change the way that you already code and can easily be adopted by existing applications.
library.name: RaptorJS Optimizer

library.description:
TypeScript is a language for application-scale JavaScript development.
TypeScript is a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.
Any browser. Any host. Any OS. Open Source.
library.name: TypeScript

library.description: Asset manager for lazy people (think homebrew for assets).
library.name: Asset

library.description: HTML5 has all of the functions necessary to draw whatever you want, but sometimes the API leaves a little to be desired. This module attempts to add convenience methods to the HTML5 API.
library.name: libcanvas

library.description:
Detect if DevTools is open.

Useful for when you want something special to happen when DevTools is open. Like pausing canvas, adding style debug info, etc.
library.name: devtools-detect

library.description: Binary data mapping for JS: StructTypes, ArrayTypes, NumberTypes. Create views on top of buffers that allow easy conversion to and from binary data.
library.name: Reified

library.description: Six is a language super-set of JavaScript that enables new syntactic features from the 6th edition of ECMAScript to be used, through a transpiler, in your scripts today.
library.name: Six

library.description: A 5k javascript date library for parsing, validating, manipulating, and formatting dates.
library.name: Moment.js
